alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:42PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wicomico and west central Worcester Counties through 515 PM EDT... At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Parsonsburg, or near Salisbury. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, heavy rain, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Salisbury, Fruitland, Salisbury University, Delmar, Parsonsburg, Pittsville, Longridge, Salisbury-Wicomico, Chesapeake Heights, Shad Point, Lakewood and Eden. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
